column4: anybody know how to get an mp3 player to mount it uses usb 1 and it is recognized immediatly on xp but linux cant mount it help please
type dmesg after plugging it in and see if it gets a drive name, like sda or sdb  or hda or hdb or something.
mount: you must specify the filesystem type error
try man mount..   find the filesystems your system supports.  mount -t fat32 /dev/sdb /mnt   mount -t ntfs /dev/sdb /mnt
how do i find the filesystem my system supports?
try cfdisk /dev/sdb  and see if it says it in there.  press q to quit it.  i wouldn't make anychanges if i were you.
how do i read the files in /proc
use the less command or cat them.
/proc/filesystems    i looked it up for you.
man i just told you.  didn't you see it ?  scroll up and read my response.
sorry i didnt know what you were saying i got it now
is it one with nodev next to it or not?
